name.text: Finding Trigonometric Ratios in a Right-Angled Triangle

questiontext.text:
Look at the figure below and use it to find the following trigonometric ratios:

[[jsxgraph]] var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard(divid, { boundingbox: [-1, 4.5, 6, -1], axis: false, showNavigation: false, showCopyright: false }); // Points with labels only (no circles) var Q = board.create('point', [0, 0], { name: 'Q', fixed: true, visible: false, label: {offset: [-15, -10], visible: true} }); var R = board.create('point', [4, 0], { name: 'R', fixed: true, visible: false, label: {offset: [10, -10], visible: true} }); var P = board.create('point', [0, 3], { name: 'P', fixed: true, visible: false, label: {offset: [-15, 10], visible: true} }); // Triangle sides board.create('segment', [Q, R]); board.create('segment', [Q, P]); board.create('segment', [P, R]); // Right-angle at Q board.create('angle', [P, Q, R], { radius: 0.4, type: 'square', name: '' }); // Angle θ at R (inside) board.create('angle', [P, R, Q], { radius: 0.6, name: '45°' }); // Length labels board.create('text', [-0.6, 1.5, '{#side#} cm']); board.create('text', [2, -0.4, '{#side#} cm']); [[/jsxgraph]]
  1. \(\text{Length of side PR }=\)[[input:ans1]]\(\,\text{cm}\)[[validation:ans1]][[feedback:prt1]]
  2. \(Tan \,45^\circ=\)[[input:ans2]][[validation:ans2]][[feedback:prt2]]
  3. \(Cos\,45^\circ=\)[[input:ans3]][[validation:ans3]][[feedback:prt3]]
  4. \(Sin\,45^\circ=\)[[input:ans4]][[validation:ans4]][[feedback:prt4]]

generalfeedback.text:
Worked Solution:

Given a right-angled triangle PQR with right angle at Q and angle \( \angle R = 45^\circ \). Let the sides opposite and adjacent to the 45° angle be equal to side cm.

  1. Length of side PR (hypotenuse):

    Using Pythagoras theorem:
    \(\begin{align} PR &= \sqrt{PQ^2 + QR^2} \\ &= \sqrt{{@side@}^2 + {@side@}^2} \\ &= \sqrt{2 \cdot {@side@}^2} \\ &= {@RP@}\, \text{ cm} \end{align}\)

  2. \(Tan \,45^\circ\):

    \(\begin{align} \tan 45^\circ &= \frac{\text{Opposite}}{\text{Adjacent}} \\ &= \frac{PQ}{QR} \\ &= \frac{{@side@}}{{@side@}}\\ &= {@tan_45@} \end{align}\)

  3. \(Cos\,45^\circ\):

    \(\begin{align} \cos 45^\circ &= \frac{\text{Adjacent}}{\text{Hypotenuse}} \\ &= \frac{{@side@}}{{@RP@}} \\ &= {@cos_45@} &\approx 0.707 \end{align}\)

  4. \(Sin\,45^\circ\):

    \(\begin{align} \sin 45^\circ &= \frac{\text{Opposite}}{\text{Hypotenuse}} \\ &= \frac{{@side@}}{{@RP@}}\\ &={@sin_45@}\\ & \approx 0.707 \end{align}\)

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

qtest.description: Test case assuming the teacher's input gets full marks.
